intro: Schiekia orinocensis, commonly known as the Orinoco schiekia, is a flowering plant native to South America, particularly Venezuela. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or red. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often growing in wetland or marshy areas. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and private collections.
